item.title: What is an API
item.description: There are millions of APIs online which provide access to data. Websites like Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook all offer certain data through their APIs. To use an API, you make a request to a remote web server, and retrieve the data you need. But why use an API instead of a static CSV dataset you can download from the web? APIs are useful in the following cases: The data is changing quickly.

item.title: Parse JSON
item.description: What is Parsing Parsing is breaking a block of data into smaller pieces (tokens) by following a set of rules (using delimiters for example), so that this data could be processes piece by piece (managed, analysed, interpreted, transmitted, ets). How do we parse JSON in Python. First we load a JSON file using json.load() method. The result is a Python dictionary. We can then access the fields using dictionary methods.
